content.webTitle: Carphone signs up 25,000 for 'free' broadband offer

fields.headline: Carphone signs up 25,000 for 'free' broadband offer
fields.bodyText: Demand for the "free" broadband offer launched by Carphone Warehouse this week has been five times greater than the company expected. The mobile phone retailer turned residential telephony provider said it had signed up 25,000 people for its TalkTalk broadband service in just two days. TalkTalk has 2.6 million phone customers, with 150,000 on broadband prior to the new offer. By March 2009 it wants 3.5 million customers with half on broadband. The company admitted on Tuesday, when the offer was launched, that its targets were conservative.
